reference.title: A startup has more than one name...types of startups
reference.shortdesc: There are many types of startups. The most popular are presented below.

row.entry: These companies, often in the tech niche, aim for a wide global reach. Their products include apps, online services, or other digital offerings.
Also known as small company ventures, these startups feature independent teams with minimal resources. They rely on self-funding, grow at their own pace, and face little pressure to scale quickly.
Born from passion and hobbies, these startups allow owners to make a living doing what they love. They typically have low scalability and modest returns on investment.
These companies are created to be sold to larger players for a profit.
Startups initiated by big corporations, leveraging the parent company's resources and technology.
These focus more on making a positive impact than on making money. They might run charities, educational prsograms, or other socially beneficial projects.
